name: Ensure to not use default stream(System.Err) for printStackTrace to print throwable and its stack trace in order to protect sensitive information.
Ensure when you build a log that accepts a format string as an argument, the argument has been sanitized when it originates from an external source.
Ensure you don't have hard-coded credentials in your source code because it could be retro-engineered by attackers.
Ensure you have secured your cookie by enabling 'Secure' attribute
Ensure when you build a log that accepts a format string as an argument, the argument has been sanitized when it originates from an external source.
Ensure you remove console.log() in your production code
Always enable HttpOnly when creating cookies to avoid Cross-site scripting attacks
Ensure you remove console.writeline() in your production code
Ensure desabling Spring Security's debug mode in production code
Ensure you don't store password information in a configuration file or a properties file in plaintext as this will allow anyone who can read the file access to the resource.
Ensure you have reviewed the web config file and update the value of debug property to false
Ensure you did not keep the tracing activated in your ASPX file to not expose sensitive information for the hackers
Ensure you did not keep the tracing activated in your web config file to not expose sensitive information for the hackers
Ensure to not use explain() method in production code so that performance is not reduced
